alert.note: Alert for Bureau; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 04 at 10:02AM CDT until April 04 at 10:45AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CDT FOR EASTERN ROCK ISLAND...WESTERN WHITESIDE...NORTHERN HENRY... NORTHWESTERN BUREAU...EASTERN SCOTT AND SOUTHEASTERN CLINTON COUNTIES... At 1001 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Port Byron, or 7 miles northeast of East Moline, moving east at 40 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM! HAZARD...90 mph wind gusts and baseball size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged or destroyed. Homes and businesses will have substantial roof and window damage. Expect extensive tree damage and power outages. This severe storm will be near... Joslin and Shady Beach around 1010 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Hillsdale, Erie, Spring Hill, Newton Corners, Fenton, Prophetstown, Prophetstown State Recreation Area, Portland Corners, Hamilton Corners, Denrock, Leon Corners, Lyndon and Round Grove. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...90 MPH
